014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Method;
017import java.util.Arrays;
018import java.util.List;
019import java.util.Optional;
020import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
021
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.JdbiOptionals;
024
025/**
026 * Registry for {@link HandlerFactory handler factories}, which produce {@link Handler handlers} for SQL object methods.
027 * By default, a factory is registered for default methods ({@link DefaultMethodHandlerFactory}) and for methods annotated
028 * with SQL annotations such as {@code @SqlUpdate} or {@code SqlQuery}. Clients may register additional factories to provide
029 * support for other use cases. In the case that two or more registered factories would support a particular SQL object
030 * method, the last-registered factory takes precedence.
031 */
032public class Handlers implements JdbiConfig<Handlers> {
033    private final List<HandlerFactory> factories = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();
034
035    public Handlers() {
036        register(new DefaultMethodHandlerFactory());
037        register(new WithHandleMethodHandlerFactory());
038        register(new SqlMethodHandlerFactory());
039        register(new BridgeMethodHandlerFactory());
040    }
041
042    private Handlers(Handlers that) {
043        factories.addAll(that.factories);
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * Registers the given handler factory with the registry.
048     * @param factory the factory to register
049     * @return this
050     */
051    public Handlers register(HandlerFactory factory) {
052        factories.add(0, factory);
053        return this;
054    }
055
056    public Optional<Handler> findFor(Class<?> sqlObjectType, Method method) {
057        return factories.stream()
058                .flatMap(factory -> JdbiOptionals.stream(factory.buildHandler(sqlObjectType, method)))
059                .findFirst();
060    }
061
062    @Override
063    public Handlers createCopy() {
064        return new Handlers(this);
065    }
066
067    static Method methodLookup(Class<?> klass, String methodName, Class<?>... parameterTypes) {
068        try {
069            return klass.getMethod(methodName, parameterTypes);
070        } catch (NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
071            throw new IllegalStateException(
072                    String.format("can't find %s#%s%s", klass.getName(), methodName, Arrays.asList(parameterTypes)), e);
073        }
074    }
075}
